questions.question_text:
Joe, a customer, wants to implement backup of his replicated VMs so production performance is not affected at the primary site.
Which of the following backup methods would be the MOST appropriate?

discussion.content:
Going with A as well. The link provided in the explanation actually proves that A is the answer.
"...provides snapshot lifecycle management for managed disks by automating periodic creation of snapshots and retaining it for configured duration using backup policy."
A couple sentences later...
" It's also an agent-less solution and doesn't impact production application performance."
That eliminates C and D.

The answer is A.

"If the primary storage array is associated with a secondary storage array, you can use the secondary storage array as a data source for backup. Backup from snapshots on secondary storage arrays reduces impact on the production storage. During backup, operations on VM data reading are performed on the side of the secondary storage array, and the primary storage array is not affected."

https://helpcenter.veeam.com/docs/backup/vsphere/storage_secondary_backup.html?ver=110
Feels like C. Questions says "each day". If it was A, for that to be a constant problem, someone would have to be clearing them out to allow it to happen again every day. Doesn't make sense.
